proTips: Always backup your existing .htaccess before replacing it
Use 301 redirects for permanent moves to preserve SEO value
Test your configuration on a staging server first
Force HTTPS only after your SSL certificate is properly installed
The order of rules in .htaccess matters - more specific rules should come first
Use browser caching aggressively for static assets but carefully for HTML
troubleshooting: If you get a 500 error, check for syntax errors in your .htaccess file
RewriteEngine must be enabled (RewriteEngine On) for redirects to work
Make sure mod_rewrite is enabled on your Apache server
Some shared hosts may restrict certain .htaccess directives
Clear browser cache after making redirect changes to see them take effect
